inout¶

Documentation for functions in the utils.inout module:

utils.inout.frextract(filepath, var, qqrng)[source]¶

Extracts the fractions and Q^2 values from the given file for all channels, putting them in a signele numpy array.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Filepath of the column file from which to extract the fractions.

  • var (str) – Variable of which to exctract fractions. Allowed values are 'pi' and 'mu' for QQpipi and QQmumu respectively.

  • qqrng (tuple(float)) – Two element tuple containing the left and right ends of the Q^2 range (in GeV^2) to extract from the file.

Returns:

9 column 2D numpy array containing the Q^2 values in the first column, and in the following columns respectively the fractions and errors: ppg, dppg, mmg, dmmg, eeg, deeg, ppp, dppp.

Return type:

numpy.array(float)

utils.inout.reswrite(fracts, resids, dresids, filename1, filename2, variable, filepath)[source]¶

Writes the given residuals, along with their errors, to the given filepath.

Parameters:

  • fracts (numpy.array(float)) – 2D numpy array containing in its first column the Q^2 values as a function of which the residuals have been calculated. The rest of the array is not used in this function and therefore is arbitrary.

  • resids (numpy.array(float)) – 4 column 2D numpy array containing in its columns respectively the residuals for: ppg, mmg, eeg, ppp.

  • dresids (numpy.array(float)) – 4 column 2D numpy array containing in its columns respectively the errors of the residuals for: ppg, mmg, eeg, ppp.

  • filename1 (str) – Name of file 1 from which the residuals have been calculated, to be inserted in the header of the output file.

  • filename1 – Name of file 2 from which the residuals have been calculated, to be inserted in the header of the output file.

  • variable (str) – Name of variable as a function of which the given residuals have been calculated, to be inserted in the header of the output file.

  • filepath (str) – Filepath of the output column file containing the residuals.

frac-comp
